data.enText: to make a substance pure by taking other substances out of it

data.chText: 炼油的 / 炼糖的工序

data.enText: to improve sth by making small changes to it

tr: make more complex, intricate, or richer
make more precise or increase the discriminatory powers of
example: refine the constant in the equation

tr: attenuate or reduce in vigor, strength, or validity by polishing or purifying
example: many valuable nutrients are refined out of the foods in our modern diet

tr: improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
reduce to a fine, unmixed, or pure state
separate from extraneous matter or cleanse from impurities
treat or prepare so as to put in a usable condition

value.def: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it.

example.ex: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
example.tran: 油经过提炼去除天然存在的杂质。

value.def: If something such as a process, theory, or machine is refined, it is improved by having small changes made to it.

example.ex: Surgical techniques are constantly being refined.
example.tran: 外科手术的技术不断得到完善。

value.tran: 改进，改善，改良（过程、理论或机器）
